TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit BitmapPalettes extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Defines several color palettes that are commonly used by bitmap images.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> properties whose names end with "Transparent" have an additional "color" that is fully transparent. In the case of palettes that already have 256 colors, the last color is replaced by the transparent color.
Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] image formats support palettes.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to construct a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by using a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> class in a similar way.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#10)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#10)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents a black-and-white color palette. This palette consists of 2 colors total.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to construct a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by using a member of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> class. Although this example shows how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes.WebPalette%2A> property, you can use any member of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> class in a similar way.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#10)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#10)]

Docs.summary: Gets a value that represents a black, white, and transparent color palette. This palette consists of 3 colors total.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> properties whose names end with "Transparent" have an additional "color" that is fully transparent. In the case of palettes that already have 256 colors, the last color is replaced by the transparent color.

remarks.format:

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes.WebPaletteTransparent%2A> is identical to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes.Halftone216Transparent%2A> palette.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapPalettes> properties whose names end with "Transparent" have an additional "color" that is fully transparent. In the case of palettes that already have 256 colors, the last color is replaced by the transparent color.
